TITLE: U.S. will again offer free at-home Covid tests starting Monday
SUMMARY: Americans will soon be able to use COVIDtests.gov to request four free tests, the Biden administration said in a release.

TITLE: Adidas CEO says Kanye West didn't mean antisemitic remarks, isn't a bad person
SUMMARY: Adidas CEO Bjorn Gulden said Kanye West didn't mean it when he made antisemitic remarks that led to the end of his Yeezy collaboration with the company.

TITLE: GM and Stellantis just laid off more than 2,000 additional workers because of the UAW's strike
SUMMARY: The UAW's strike is already affecting other GM and Stellantis factories, where nearly 2,400 workers were laid off Wednesday.

TITLE: Fall Covid shot rollout gets off to a bumpy start as some patients see insurance delays
SUMMARY: The reports are fueling confusion among insured patients about whether they can still access Covid shots for free — just as cases tick up across the country.

TITLE: Anheuser-Busch to stop cutting off Clydesdale horse tails after backlash
SUMMARY: Anheuser-Busch is bringing an end to the controversial practice of cutting off the tails of its Clydesdale horses for cosmetic purposes.

TITLE: GM executive slams UAW over 'flow of misinformation,' rhetoric during strike
SUMMARY: President Mark Reuss focused on the union's public bashing of GM and elements of the company's "record" contract proposal that included 20% pay raises.

TITLE: Philip Morris considers selling stake in pharmaceuticals unit to boost health-care division
SUMMARY: The company's wellness division has struggled, and Philip Morris has had talks with Deutsche Bank on a range of options.

TITLE: Walmart opens a pet center with veterinary care and grooming as it signals bigger ambitions
SUMMARY: With the move, Walmart, the nation's largest grocer, is signaling bigger ambitions in the pet industry after decades of selling dog food and other pet supplies.

TITLE: Kraft recalls 84,000 cases of American cheese slices over choking hazard
SUMMARY: Kraft Heinz announced a recall of Kraft Singles cheese slices after customers complained of choking.

TITLE: SpaceX countersues Justice Department, seeking to dismiss hiring discrimination case
SUMMARY: Elon Musk's SpaceX sued the U.S. Department of Justice in a Texas federal court, aiming to stop the DOJ's hiring discrimination case on constitutional grounds.

TITLE: Eli Lilly sues clinics allegedly selling knockoff versions of Mounjaro diabetes drug
SUMMARY: The lawsuits come as Eli Lilly grapples with a shortage of Mounjaro in the U.S. due to skyrocketing demand.

TITLE: Live sports are headed to Max, as Warner Bros. Discovery adds a new tier to streaming app
SUMMARY: Warner Bros. Discovery said it will add a live sports tier to streamer Max on Oct. 5, bring NBA, NHL, MLB and March Madness games to the platform.

TITLE: Uninsured Americans can still get free Covid boosters — here's how to find them
SUMMARY: The new Covid vaccines from Pfizer and Moderna began to roll out last week after the CDC recommended them to all Americans ages 6 months and up.

TITLE: Ford barrels toward new Canadian strike that could affect F-Series pickup production
SUMMARY: Canadian union Unifor and Ford are approaching an 11:59 p.m. ET Tuesday deadline to reach an agreement for about 5,600 autoworkers before a strike could occur.

TITLE: Disney plans to nearly double its investment in parks and cruises business
SUMMARY: Disney's theme parks have been a relative bright spot while the entertainment giant struggles to make a profit on streaming.

TITLE: After a year of chaos, CNN bets on new CEO Thompson to focus on long-term viability
SUMMARY: New CNN CEO Mark Thompson begins his job in October, and he'll likely focus on building a subscription digital business around CNN and CNN.com.

TITLE: White House no longer sending top officials to Detroit for UAW strike talks this week
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden largely sided with the striking autoworkers in an address Friday but has received a relatively cold reception from the UAW.

TITLE: EV charging needs big improvements soon if the auto industry's transition is going to work
SUMMARY: There's a groundswell forming to expand and improve the U.S. charging landscape for EVs, but experts agree there's a long road ahead.

TITLE: Kevin Durant's Boardroom launches entertainment and sports advisory firm
SUMMARY: NBA superstar Kevin Durant and partner Rich Kleiman are expanding beyond their Boardroom media business.

TITLE: UAW will strike at additional U.S. auto plants if 'serious progress' isn't made by noon Friday
SUMMARY: The timing of the additional plants would come just over a week after the union announced targeted strikes at assembly plants of about 12,700 autoworkers.

TITLE: Rocket Lab stock drops after first satellite launch failure in more than two years
SUMMARY: Rocket Lab's 41st Electron rocket launch failed about two minutes and 30 seconds after lifting off from New Zealand.

TITLE: New York is cracking down on illegal weed stores as legal market struggles to take hold
SUMMARY: New York is stepping up its efforts to stop unlicensed smoke shops from selling marijuana, as the state struggles to boot up its legal marketplace.

TITLE: Stellantis could close 18 facilities under UAW deal — here are the full details of its latest offer
SUMMARY: The company made the latest offer Thursday, before the start of targeted strikes by the United Auto Workers Union against Stellantis, Ford and GM.

TITLE: Writers union will resume strike negotiations with studios this week
SUMMARY: The WGA and the AMPTP will start talking again. Dual writers and actors strikes have shut down Hollywood.

TITLE: Americans plan to keep cutting back on spending through the holidays, new survey says
SUMMARY: U.S. consumers have cut back on spending and plan to continue to do so through the holiday shopping season, a new CNBC-Morning Consult survey says.

TITLE: Morgan Stanley kicks off generative AI era on Wall Street with assistant for financial advisors
SUMMARY: Morgan Stanley says it is the first major Wall Street firm to put a bespoke solution based on GPT-4 in employees' hands.

TITLE: Golf legend Gary Player says government should stay out of sports
SUMMARY: Hall of fame golfer Gary Player talks about the intersection of golf and politics, and weighs in on the upcoming Ryder Cup in Italy.

TITLE: Clorox says last month's cyberattack is still disrupting production
SUMMARY: Clorox said a cyberattack it disclosed last month will have a material impact on its fiscal first quarter results.

TITLE: Homebuilder sentiment goes negative for the first time in 7 months, thanks to higher mortgage rates
SUMMARY: Homebuilder sentiment fell into negative territory as potential buyers struggle to afford new homes in a higher mortgage rate environment.

TITLE: Hollywood is paying a steep price for never really figuring out the streaming model
SUMMARY: Streaming broke the traditional media model. Legacy media companies are still figuring out the future, while holding on to that model for as long as possible.
